page.title: 08Dunge Hamlet.
page.content: Dunge hamlet is a medieval settlement that grew up on the edge of the parish boundries of West Ashton, Edington and Bratton. The name Dunge is derived from the O.E. dyncge, meaning manured land. Today Dunge consists of 3 farms. Dunge, Lower Dunge and Grange Farm. Dunge and Lower Dunge farms total 220 acres of land together. They are worked by two generations of the Oram family. The dairy herd numbers 200 friesian cows, and 50 acres are given over to wheat production. Owing to the limitations imposed by the E.E.C.milk quotas curbing further expansion of the dairy herd for the forseeable future, a decision has been made to experiment with keeping a flock of sheep at Lower Dunge Farm. Lower Dunge farm is of interest as it is a moated site. The moat is
